alert.note: Alert for Fremont (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Omaha (Eastern Nebraska and Southeastern Iowa - Omaha Valley)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 07 at 8:59AM CDT by NWS Omaha
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Fremont, southeastern Lancaster, Johnson, northwestern Nemaha, Otoe, northeastern Gage and southeastern Cass Counties through 930 AM CDT... At 859 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 5 miles northwest of Nehawka to 3 miles east of Douglas to 5 miles south of Firth. Movement was southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree branches and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Nehawka around 905 AM CDT. Union around 910 AM CDT. Cook around 915 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Nebraska City, Tecumseh, Talmage, Crab Orchard, Brock and Johnson. This includes Interstate 29 between mile markers 10 and 17. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
